title: For Sale:  Brand new Umarex HK 416 D145RS .22 LR 20 Round Magazine Rifle
postcontent:
Brand new in Box .22 HK 416 20 round. NOT CALIFORNIA COMPLIANT. FFL to FFL only if shipping. Cash or cashiers check/personal. 4 8 0 2 1 5 1 3 4 3 call or text $1000 OBO. I have 7 of these left now out. Just sold 10.

Heckler & Koch & Umarex have combined forces to create a 416 in .22LR. The highly-anticipated HK 416 style rifle are officially-licensed by HK and fire the inexpensive and affordable .22LR ammunition. Specifications: Action: Semi-Automatic Barrel: 16.1 inches Caliber: .22 LR Magazine Capacity: 20 round Grips/Stock: Collapsible Sights: Dipoter Style / Adjustable The .22 caliber HK 416 is loaded with authentic features. From its appearance, feel, and operation, right down to the sling swivel incorporated into the stock, the 416 D145RS is a replica in every sense. Like all the .22LR H&Ks offered by Umarex, the 416 is a dedicated .22 rimfire rifle. It is engineered and built in Germany by Carl Walther with a match grade precision barrel, upper and lower metal receivers, a retractable stock, and a machined rail interface system. The 416's pistol grip and butt stock are authentic in that they include storage compartments for small tools or batteries. The magazines for the .22 caliber 416 are made of high strength polymer and are designed to make loading simple and efficient.

title: For Sale:  2 FOR 1 AR 15 PROJECT RIFLES!!
postcontent:
I'm going to try this one more time.

First of All:

PLEASE.

1. If the ad is still posted the rifles are still available. Please.
2. This is a package deal....All or None. Please.

Yes. They are AR15 rifles. 
Yes. They are standard .223/5.56 caliber.
Yes. They are black. 
Yes. They are semiautomatic.
Yes. You can paint them any color you want.
Yes. They are absolutely legal to own in the states that matter. :)
Yes. AR15s are very fun to shoot and have very little recoil to them.
No. These are A2 uppers....mounting glass is tough....you want an A4 upper for that.
No. These are NOT MACHINE GUNS.
No. I DO NOT SHIP OVERSEAS.
No. I DO NOT SHIP TO NY/MA/CA/IL or any other anti 2nd amendment state. Sorry.
No. I DON'T CARE WHO YOU ARE - FFL REQUIRED TO SHIP THESE GUNS ANYWHERE.

LOL....I know...I apologize for my Captain Obvious routine....but you wouldn't believe some of the queries I've fielded.

Now that is out of the way.
---------------------------------------------------------

2 x Superior Arms AR lower receivers - Brand New

2 x Delton LPK including standard grip and trigger kit - Brand New

1 x Bolt/Carrier/Charging Handle Assembly - Used but good condition

1 x Old School Triangle Handguards A2 Assembled Upper - Used but good condition  
No visible mfg marks.
--- Complete with peep sight/20" std weight barrel/flash hider 

1 x Standard A2 Round Handguards Assembled Upper - Used but good condition
No visible mfg marks.
--- Complete with peep sight/20" med weight barrel/flash hider

I Don't Have a round count for these uppers..... but the feedramps and muzzles have no signs of extreme usage.

2 x Standard A1/A2 buttstocks - Very Used (ie not pretty) but absolutely functional
YES -  YOU CAN PAINT THEM - :)

2 x 6" standard black forearm furniture pieces....new?? .....extras tossed in! 

PRICE: $1000 SHIPPED TO FFL or $950 FTF SALE LOCAL
PRICE IS FIRM. 
NO TRADES/SWAPS/BARTERS/NEGOTIATIONS/BESTOFFERS. 
PLEASE.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
WHAT IS NEEDED TO COMPLETE THESE 2 x AR15 SEMIAUTOMATIC RIFLES???
2 x butt tube/spring/retaining nut assembly - Not real tough to find online.
You could go with entire buttstock kit for a bit more money.

1 x Bolt/Carrier/Charging handle assembly - Yes....Getting much tougher to find but I know one website that says they still have in stock for $155 each. I didn't try to order so I didn't verify their in-stock claim.

Bottom line....I don't see it costing any more than $300-$350 at the most to finish and end up with 2 rifles....thats if you have to buy everything brand new.....and paint them any color you want! 
:)

VOILA - TWO AR15 RIFLES FOR ~$650/EACH!! 
Where you gonna find a deal like that these days??

Please put "I'M A DIRTY GUN LOVER" in the subject line to weed out the spammers.
:)

HAPPY NEW YEAR!

title: For Sale:  Notice to NC Gun Owners
postcontent:
This is the response I received from Congressman David Price when I wrote and stated my concern for any new gun laws. I thought this should be read by law abiding NC gun owners, but did not know where to post it. Feel free to spread this letter and post anywhere you feel it will do some good.

Thank you for contacting me regarding the recent mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut.  I share your profound sadness at this senseless act of violence, which has taken an unimaginable toll on the families of the victims, the Newtown community, and the nation as a whole.  I also appreciate your sharing your ideas for gun reform.

This is a time of national mourning, as well as a time for serious soul-searching and reflection.  The Newtown tragedy is just the most recent reminder that our current laws are failing to keep guns out of the hands of those intent on doing harm.  The time has come for a renewed focus on gun violence in this country, one that acknowledges that common-sense precautions can help prevent these terrible tragedies while still allowing law-abiding citizens to own and use guns.  I refuse to believe that this issue is too complicated or politically divisive to be addressed comprehensively and conclusively.  Surely the horror of Sandy Hook should be sufficient to spur us to action.

To that end, I strongly support legislation that would keep assault weapons and high-capacity magazines--which have no legitimate self-defense or recreational purpose--off of our streets.  I have also co-sponsored a measure that would close the "gun show loophole," which allows as many as 40 percent of all guns sold in the United States to change hands without criminal background checks.  As we look ahead to the new Congress, I am actively considering other reforms that could help prevent another Sandy Hook, Aurora, Oak Creek, Tuscon, or Virginia Tech.

This tragedy is also a reminder that we must address the way in which we treat mental illness in this country.  For too long those suffering from these disorders have been stigmatized and isolated from society.  The support and treatment we need to offer are currently being compromised, in North Carolina and elsewhere, by misguided budget priorities.  We must do better, especially in reaching out to troubled young people.

You may wish to read my recent statement on the Sandy Hook tragedy at http://go.usa.gov/gGfH.  Again, thank you for contacting me, and please continue to keep in touch on issues of concern.


Sincerely,

DAVID PRICE

DAVID PRICE
Member of Congress
